text: On November 6th, we take our fight against the attack on Black bodies and our communities to the poll! By voting for progressive candidates who champion our issues, we ensure our representation in the state, local, and federal government! #BlackLivesMatter #ElectionDay #Vote https://t.co/QtXyrvCCKP
@kendrick38 has been an active #BLM member in @BLMLA and has been so amazing to work with. https://t.co/TellzGB7rZ

We stand with the historic number of Black and progressive candidates who join us in the fight against the issues that continue to disproportionately affect our communities. #BlackLivesMatter #Vote #BlackNovember https://t.co/mqCWQqJYjA

#TBT –Voting obstacles for Black people have historically been deep-seeded in the U.S. to discourage us from taking Black power to the polls. Despite these obstacles, our ancestors continued to challenge voting laws. #BlackLivesMatter #BlackNovember #Vote https://t.co/vThZXAKIlh
Sending all of our love and strength to #DanyeJones and his entire community. We are with you. Whatever we can do to support please let us know. Beyond a tragedy.

We condemn the violent acts of terrorism and hate this week. Though it can be hard to stay the course, we must and we will. We will never stop fighting to end white supremacy forever. #TreeofLife #Pittsburghshooting #BlackLivesMatter
One of our founding members of Black Lives Matter Canada speaks the truth around what is privilege? @janaya_khan thank you for your sharp analysis! https://t.co/pe2xaHSBGh

BLM has stated from the beginning that we must fight for those at the margins, Black trans folk who have been been tossed aside by EVERYONE. Now is the time we STOP this administration from trying to erase  trans people. We can’t let them come for us. ALL #BlackLivesMatter

‘Transgender’ Could Be Defined Out of Existence Under Trump Administration - The New York Times 

We know the grave impact this transphobic legislation would have on Black trans people in particular. We must fight for ALL Black Lives. https://t.co/Jzii1ux5I7

While many of us were in celebration of Black life at @afropunk in Atlanta another family member was gunned down. 

May we get the Justice we deserve in this life time. #JusticeForChineduOkobi https://t.co/WPk4vKP9Zr
Jane Fonda and Patrisse Khan-Cullors on the Sobering Realities of Racism https://t.co/ShMa38r8Bj via @harpersbazaarus #BlackLivesMatter #BlackFeminism
#Kavanaugh confirmation is completely devastating and a slap in the face to the lives of #Survivors. We will resist this administration — as long as it takes. #BlackLivesMatter

Jason Van Dyke is guilty of murdering Laquan McDonald. While this is a victory, we will continue to fight for divestment in law enforcement, investment in our communities and a world where Black people are not gunned down by police.#blacklivesmatter #divest#vandykemurdertrial

Go ‘head @BLMSacramento, @BLMLA, @BLMLBC! With your help, we were able to get @NancySkinnerCA’s “Right to Know” bill passed. We will keep pushing to break the systemic processes that result in Black people being killed by police without consequence. #BlackLivesMatter #OurVictory
Sending this brother’s family all our love on this day. https://t.co/p5zUoMh5Xn
Sending all survivors, especially Black women and femmes, the love, strength and fortitude to heal from a lifetime of harm and violence against our bodies. #BlackLivesMatter #KavanaughHearing
@DocMellyMel is being persecuted by the Los Angeles city attorney. If you are in Los Angeles come out and pack the court this Friday! @BLMLA #BlackLivesMatter https://t.co/75KTHLLEoC

We must take our demands to the polls on election day and fight for our communities! Find your local polling location at https://t.co/ZjA2w8kDPV #BlackLivesMatter #BlackVotesMatter #NationalVoterRegistrationDay

@BLMSacramento’s message is clear: stop using our tax-dollars to over-police communities and start actually investing in them! #BlackLivesMatter #Justice4StephonClark #DivestToReinvest #BLMSacramento #NotInOurState

@BLMSacramento is on the ground at the California Peace Officers Association’s Cop West Expo to demand law enforcement re-evaluates their existing training and holds officers accountable for excessive force and murder. #BlackLivesMatter #BLMSacramento #EnoughIsEnough

@BLMSacramento is on the ground right now at the California Peace Officers Association’s Cop West Expo to demand law enforcement re-evaluates their existing training and holds officers accountable for excessive force and murder. #BlackLivesMatter #BLMSacramento #EnoughIsEnough
Today marks 6 months since Stephon Clark was killed by the @SacPolice in his grandmother’s backyard #SayHisName #BlackLivesMatter #BLMSacramento #Justice4StephonClark #NotInOurState
Tragic. We stand with the Dallas community. Especially Black folks who have been impacted by state violence. https://t.co/jnQMi7WHsU

Rest In Peace to the Queen of Soul. Thank you for loving us deeply and sharing your brilliance, so that we may feel more because of your voice and music for lifetimes to come.

BLM works to exemplify the world we want to live in. A world of love where there is no white supremacy, where Black people are liberated and all people are free. #blacklivesmatter #ShutItDownDC #RiseUpFightBack

Today, we create a safe space for people to lift their voices in opposition of white supremacy and the hate rhetoric intended to terrorize our communities. #riseupandfightback #blacklivesmatter https://t.co/KxlTHv8l8h
We denounce #unitetheright and it’s violence and hate rhetoric. Today, we’re gonna join together to imagine a world where everyone is free. @shutitdowndc #blacklivesmatter https://t.co/yt01LHQpSP

Mike Brown we love you. We will always love you. May you rest in power. #MikeBrownForever
Congratulations to @iKaylaReed and the powerful work of local folks in St. Louis. 27 years of white supremacy was knocked to its knees tonight. Big win for the movement! #MikeBrownForever
https://t.co/kgZPHYElz3 we want to make it clear that Hawk Newsome is not apart of Black Lives Matter and should not be labeled as such. We did not endorse this rally. @NYDailyNews

To celebrate our 5th anniversary we sat down with some of our chapter leaders to dig into our work over the last five years; check out the full trailer on our website now: https://t.co/5HE6Rx8n4f #5YearsOfBLM #BlackLivesMatter

Black Lives Matter Global Network will release a series of video shorts. BLM chapter co-founders will bring you front-line as they describe, first hand, the organization's origin and it's work felt deeply within their communities, throughout this network and around the world. https://t.co/vyNAPeRz9V
Follow our comrades from @BYP_100 in Chicago right now. https://t.co/PDpLCZVBIX
#BlackLivesMatter is 5 years old. Come celebrate our network. https://t.co/ayKzLmb4aE

We are able to do this work because of the depth and breadth of leadership inside of our Network and across the @mvmt4bl. Please check out some of our co-conspirators for liberation @PowerDignity  @BYP_100 @ignitekindred @Dreamdefenders @BAJItweet @ProjectSouth @BmoreBloc
Donate now to directly support the critical work of our membership: https://t.co/9OebdcRDIz #5YearsofBLM https://t.co/mCiBoxIMUj
We are indebted to the Black Freedom Fighters of Ferguson, and the legacy of Mike Brown. #5YearsofBLM #BlackLivesMatter
This is also the anniversary of the acquittal of George Zimmerman. We are forever in remembrance of and grateful to Ancestor Trayvon Martin. #5YearsofBLM #BlackLivesMatter
Today @BlkLivesMatter celebrates five years of shutting down, dismantling, and discrediting anti-Black systems of oppression. #5YearsofBLM https://t.co/l3KCS2EH8c

Today, @BlkLivesMatter celebrates five years of commitment to centering the voices of everyday people and mobilizing millions of people globally. Learn about where #BlackLivesMatter is today: https://t.co/hQPsMdrz5q
Today marks #5YearsofBLM -- an affirmation of Black folks’ contributions to this society, our humanity, & our resilience in the face of deadly oppression. https://t.co/hQPsMdrz5q

Through movement and relationship building, we have also helped catalyze other movements and shifted culture with an eye toward the dangerous impacts of anti-Blackness. #5YearsofBLM https://t.co/hQPsMdrz5q

Organizers who call this network home have ousted anti-Black politicians, won critical legislation to benefit Black lives, and changed the terms of conversations around Blackness globally. #5YearsofBLM #BlackLivesMatter
Ferguson helped to catalyze a movement to which we’ve all helped give life. #5YearsofBLM #BlackLivesMatter

Forever changed, we returned home and began building the infrastructure for the @BlackLivesMatter Global Network, which, even in its infancy, has become a political home for many. #5YearsofBLM #BlackLivesMatter

A year later, we took the #BlackLivesMatter Freedom Ride to Ferguson, in search of justice for Mike Brown and all who have been torn apart by state-sanctioned violence and anti-Black racism. #5YearsofBLM

mentions.name: Power U Center For Social Change

text: We were inspired by the 31-day takeover of the Florida State Capitol by @PowerU305 and the @Dreamdefenders. #5YearsofBLM #BlackLivesMatter
Enraged by the death of Trayvon Martin and the subsequent acquittal of his killer, George Zimmerman, we took to the streets. #5YearsofBLM #BlackLivesMatter
The impetus for that commitment was, and still is, the rampant and deliberate violence inflicted on us by the state. #5YearsofBLM #BlackLivesMatter
Our intention from the very beginning was to connect Black people from all over the world who have a shared desire for justice to act together in their communities. #5YearsofBLM #BlackLivesMatter
#BlackLivesMatter began as a call to action in response to state-sanctioned violence and anti-Black racism. #5YearsofBLM #BlackLivesMatter

For five years, we’ve committed to struggling together and to imagining and creating a world free of anti-Blackness, where every Black person has the social, economic, and political power to thrive. #5YearsofBLM #BlackLivesMatter https://t.co/hQPsMdrz5q

Today, @BlkLivesMatter is a chapter-based, member-led organization whose mission is to build local power and to intervene when violence is inflicted on Black communities by the state and vigilantes. #5YearsofBLM #BlackLivesMatter
@BlkLivesMatter started five years ago today, as a Black-centered political will and movement building project. #5YearsofBLM
Five years ago today, what is now known as the @BlkLivesMatter Global Network began to organize. Learn more: https://t.co/hQPsMdrz5q
Today (July 13) marks the 5-year anniversary of @BlkLivesMatter. #5YearsofBLM https://t.co/hQPsMdrz5q #BlackLivesMatter https://t.co/Wyfzni9NRU
https://t.co/VikxaEq8uY today is the 5th anniversary of #BlackLivesMatter a generation of us launched a global movement and network. We ain’t going nowhere and we are stronger than ever.
We always show up for ours. https://t.co/PnLCTty5Am
Therese Patricia Okoumou climbed the Statue of Liberty on July 4th to demand freedom for the children held by ICE and to uplift the #AbolishICE demand. She was arrested and will be arraigned.
@AsiaKateDillon will be out in support of #TheresePatriciaOkoumou tomorrow morning! Will you be there? #AbolishICE #SayHerName https://t.co/8glbaucudW

Patricia will be arraigned tomorrow, July 5th, 2018. She will go before a federal judge at 9am at 500 Pearl St. 3rd Floor. We will have a team out to support her. Please show up if you can. #TheresePatriciaOkoumou #BlackLivesMatter #AbolishICE https://t.co/7A9RyOc4mf

@Blklivesmatter global network stands in solidarity with Therese Patricia Okoumou, Black immigrant woman who courageously scaled the Statue of Liberty to protest this unjust government. Please call the metro correctional center in nyc - 646 836 6300 and ask for her release. https://t.co/gp0mdzzmLd

On June 19, 1865 Union soliders arrived in Galveston, Texas to inform remaining Black slaves that they were free from bondage. Today, we celebrate our ancestors’ #freedomday and commit to continue our collective fight for dignity and liberation. #juneteenth #independenceday #blm https://t.co/7M4Lje26wh

#SayHerName https://t.co/GvQkl2Nbow
@BYP_100 Q8 3/3 Folks can learn new transformative and restorative practices that affirm and uplift the humanity of Black women and girls.

@BYP_100 Q8 2/3 Listen and believe Black women, girls, and femmes when we speak about our experiences. Be aware & engaged in the fight to end systemic violence that is perpetuated against us— connect locally w/ Black women, girls, & femmes who are building for our collective liberation.

@BYP_100 Q8 1/3 Take the time to study white supremacy and antiBlackness, and how it shows up in your attitudes, interactions and relationships at home, at work, and especially with Black women, girls, and femmes in your life

@BYP_100 A7 2/2 When we are actively in the practice of personal and communal transformation, we begin to disengage ourselves from systems that seek our destruction and instead look to one another for solutions and support.
@BYP_100 A7 1/2 We must continue to equip ourselves with the tools to carry out healing justice and instill transformative justice practices in our communities.

@BYP_100 We must #SayHerName to remind everyone that there are Black women, girls and femmes who are harmed and invisibilized by so many systems, and who will continue to suffer unless we are intentional about our collective freedom.
@BYP_100 Q1:  As we engage in the process of freeing ourselves and our communities, we must always remember we who are left unaddressed.
